page.title: 05DALE END PARK IRONBRIDGE
page.content: The park was the grounds of Dale End House Coalbrookdale, which was used as a police station before TDC turned the area into a park. The area is 6.25 hectares. The Grand Fir in Dale End park is 40 metres high, it is the tallest tree in Telford. A rare dragon fly, the club-tail, has been found in the park. There is a camp site which Telford Social Development Department own. The price for a night per adult is Â£1.00, per child 50p. On June 12 1985 Dale End Park will be walked as part of the Ramblers Association nationwide JUBILEE WALK. The park warden looks after the wild animals in the park, to make sure that they are not harmed. Picnics in the park do not worry the animals because they eat the picnic scraps.
